## Step 1: What is QMD format? {#sec-qmd-intro}

<div class="workflow-step" id="step-qmd">
<span class="step-counter">1</span>**Understanding QMD Format** 

COLIB uses **Quarto Markdown (QMD)** format for all documentation pages. QMD is an extension of standard Markdown that allows you to:

- Write scientific documentation with LaTeX math equations
- Include executable code blocks
- Create interactive plots and figures
- Generate citations and references automatically
- Produce high-quality HTML, PDF, and other output formats

:::{.callout-note}
## QMD Benefits for Scientific Documentation:

- Native support for mathematical equations using LaTeX syntax
- Automatic cross-referencing of figures, tables, and equations
- Bibliography management with BibTeX
- Code execution and result embedding
- Professional formatting and styling
:::

<button class="next-step-button" onclick="showStep('step-install')">Continue to Installation →</button>
</div>

## Step 2: Install Quarto {#sec-install-quarto}

<div class="workflow-step" id="step-install" style="display: none;">
<span class="step-counter">2</span>**Installing Quarto** 

### Installation

#### 1. Install Quarto
Visit the [official Quarto website](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) and download the installer for your operating system:

- **Windows**: Download the `.msi` installer
- **macOS**: Download the `.pkg` installer  
- **Linux**: Use the appropriate package manager or download the `.deb`/`.rpm` package

#### 2. Verify Installation
Open a terminal/command prompt and run:
```bash
quarto --version
```

#### 3. Install a Text Editor (Recommended)
While you can edit QMD files with any text editor, we recommend:

- **VS Code** with the Quarto extension
- **RStudio** (built-in Quarto support)
- **Jupyter Lab** (built-in Quarto support)

:::{.callout-note}
You can install the Quarto extension from within the Extensions tab in VS Code, from the [Extension Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=quarto.quarto), the [Open VSX Registry](https://open-vsx.org/extension/quarto/quarto) or directly from a [VISX extension file](https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-vscode#visx-install).
:::

<button class="next-step-button" onclick="showStep('step-template')">Continue to Template Selection →</button>
</div>

## Step 3: Download Template {#sec-template-selection}

<div class="workflow-step" id="step-template" style="display: none;">
<span class="step-counter">3</span>**Choose Your Template** 

COLIB provides two main contribution templates depending on what you want to add:

### Model Template
Use the **Model Template** when you want to contribute:

- Mathematical models of power system components
- Control system descriptions
- Algorithm implementations
- Component behavior models

<a href="../download/modelTemplate.zip" download="modelTemplate.zip" class="btn-main">
  <i class="fas fa-download"></i> Download model template
</a>

:::{.callout-note}
## Model template includes:

- Context (mandatory)
- Model use, assumptions, validity domain and limitations (mandatory)
- Model description (mandatory)
- Source code (optional)
- Open source implementations (if any)
- Table of references & license
:::

### Test Case Template
Use the **Test Case Template** when you want to contribute:

- Validation scenarios
- Benchmark test systems
- Simulation examples
- Performance comparisons

<a href="../download/testCaseTemplate.zip" download="testCaseTemplate.zip" class="btn-main">
  <i class="fas fa-download"></i> Download test case template
</a>

:::{.callout-note}
## Test case template includes:

- Use case purpose​ and context (mandatory)
- Network ​description (mandatory)
- Static and Dynamic models​ description (mandatory)
- Input Data (mandatory)
- Scenarios (at least one mandatory)
- Simulation parameters (optional)
- Outputs (mandatory)
- Open source implementations (if any)
- Table of references & license
:::

<button class="next-step-button" onclick="showStep('step-fill-template')">Continue to Template Completion →</button>
</div>

## Step 4: Fill Your Template {#sec-fill-template}

<div class="workflow-step" id="step-fill-template" style="display: none;">
<span class="step-counter">4</span>**Complete Your Template** 

Now let's help you fill out your template step by step. We'll guide you through each section:

<div class="template-sections">
  <div class="section-card" onclick="expandSection('context-section')">
    <h4><i class="fas fa-info-circle"></i> Context Section</h4>
    <p>Describe the background and motivation for your contribution</p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="section-content" id="context-section" style="display: none;">
    <h5>What to include in Context:</h5>
    <ul>
      <li>Background information and motivation</li>
      <li>Why this model/test case is needed</li>
      <li>How it fits into power system analysis</li>
    </ul>
    
    <textarea class="section-editor" id="context-editor" placeholder="Write your context section here...

Example:
This synchronous generator model is essential for transient stability studies in power systems. It provides accurate representation of machine dynamics during fault conditions..."></textarea>
    
    <button class="validate-section" onclick="validateSection('context')">Validate Context Section</button>
    <div class="validation-result" id="context-validation"></div>
  </div>

  <div class="section-card" onclick="expandSection('model-section')">
    <h4><i class="fas fa-cogs"></i> Model Description</h4>
    <p>Detailed technical description of your model or test case</p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="section-content" id="model-section" style="display: none;">
    <h5>What to include in Model Description:</h5>
    <ul>
      <li>Mathematical equations and formulations</li>
      <li>Variables and parameters</li>
      <li>Implementation details</li>
      <li>Assumptions and limitations</li>
    </ul>
    
    <textarea class="section-editor" id="model-editor" placeholder="Write your model description here...

Include:
- Mathematical equations using LaTeX syntax: $$P = \frac{E \times V \times \sin(\delta)}{X}$$
- Variable definitions
- Parameter descriptions"></textarea>
    
    <button class="validate-section" onclick="validateSection('model')">Validate Model Section</button>
    <div class="validation-result" id="model-validation"></div>
  </div>

  <div class="section-card" onclick="expandSection('references-section')">
    <h4><i class="fas fa-book"></i> References & License</h4>
    <p>Citations and licensing information</p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="section-content" id="references-section" style="display: none;">
    <h5>What to include in References:</h5>
    <ul>
      <li>Academic papers and books</li>
      <li>Standards and guidelines</li>
      <li>Software documentation</li>
      <li>License information</li>
    </ul>
    
    <textarea class="section-editor" id="references-editor" placeholder="Add your references here...

Example:
[@kundur1994power] Kundur, P. (1994). Power system stability and control. McGraw-hill.
[@ieee2016guide] IEEE Guide for Synchronous Generator Modeling Practices and Applications in Power System Stability Analyses."></textarea>
    
    <button class="validate-section" onclick="validateSection('references')">Validate References Section</button>
    <div class="validation-result" id="references-validation"></div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="template-completion-status" id="completion-status">
  <h4>Template Completion Status:</h4>
  <div class="progress-bar">
    <div class="progress-fill" id="progress-fill"></div>
  </div>
  <p id="completion-text">Complete all sections to proceed to validation</p>
</div>

<button class="next-step-button" id="continue-validation" onclick="showStep('step-validate')" style="display: none;">Continue to Validation →</button>
</div>

<div class="validation-panel">

</div>

<button class="next-step-button" id="continue-submit" onclick="showStep('step-submit')" style="display: none;">Continue to Submission →</button>

<div class="workflow-step" id="step-submit" style="display: none;">

  <a href="https://github.com/CRESYM/Colib_Quarto.github.io/issues/new?assignees=GJCRESYM%2C+matoubongrain&labels=enhancement%2Cbug%2Cevaluate+component&projects=Colib0&template=Evaluate.yml&title=%5BName%2FID+of+the+model%2F+test+case+to+be+evaluated%5D%3A+"

      <li><strong>Publication:</strong> Approved contributions are merged and published</li>

## Improve Existing Content {#sec-improve-content}

<div class="workflow-step">
<span class="step-counter">1</span>**Choose Improvement Type** 

You can contribute to COLIB by improving existing content in several ways:

<div class="improvement-options">
  <div class="improvement-card" onclick="openGitHubIssue('bug')">
    <div class="improvement-icon">🐛</div>
    <h4>Report a Bug</h4>
    <p>Found an error, typo, or technical inaccuracy? Report it so we can fix it.</p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="improvement-card" onclick="openGitHubIssue('enhancement')">
    <div class="improvement-icon">✨</div>
    <h4>Suggest Enhancement</h4>
    <p>Have ideas to improve existing models, add missing details, or enhance documentation?</p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="improvement-card" onclick="openGitHubIssue('documentation')">
    <div class="improvement-icon">📝</div>
    <h4>Documentation Improvement</h4>
    <p>Help improve clarity, add examples, or update references in existing pages.</p>
  </div>
</div>

:::{.callout-tip}
## Tips for Effective Contributions

- **Be specific**: Include page links, section references, and clear descriptions
- **Provide context**: Explain why the change is needed and how it improves COLIB
- **Suggest solutions**: When possible, provide specific text or code improvements
- **Include references**: Support your suggestions with relevant sources
:::
